name: ripple effect pot holder
sizes_available: it measures 7" wide x 7" long, but instructions are provided to customize the size of the pot holder.
notes:
add some texture and warmth to your kitchen with the ripple effect pot holder! it’s beautiful, useful, and makes a great conversation piece. this pot holder is made using the half double crochet in the third loop only stitch to create a knit-like texture. it is constructed using the magic pot holder technique to create a double thick pot holder that protects your hands, counters, and furniture. 

> this pot holder pattern is week 3 of the **[pot holders galore crochet-along][1]**. with the purchase of the ebook, you will receive a total of 6 pot holder patterns (one pattern every week during the crochet-along). on week 5, there will 2 pot holder patterns available. however, the free pattern (with ads) and video tutorial are linked below.

what can i use a pot holder for?
pot holders are practical items that you can use in the kitchen:
* set a scolding pot/pan/baking sheet/casserole dish on a pot holder to protect your counters and furniture.

* use them like oven mitts when taking something out of the oven or microwave.

* use them as a portable placemat. place a pot holder underneath a hot bowl or plate, so you can carry your food to the table or the couch.

* use them as a coaster for hot drinks!

> the free pattern for the ripple effect pot holder can be found [**here**][2]!

> the complete video tutorial can be found [**here!**][3]
